title: Sudan conflict: No benefit in talks without truce, says al-Burhan
description: Sudan's army chief Abdel Fattah al-Burhan says no settlement with RSF without a permanent ceasefire in Khartoum.

title: Canada expelling Chinese diplomat over alleged legislator threats
description: Canadian foreign minister says Zhao Wei declared 'persona non grata' after alleged intimidation of opposition lawmaker.

title: After two mass shootings, Serbians rally against violence
description: Tens of thousands rally in Belgrade, demanding resignation of key ministers and a ban on violent TV content.

title: Will Syria’s return to Arab League usher in new era of stability?
description: After 12 years of civil war and government crackdowns in Syria, the Arab League has reinstated the country.

title: US jury hears closing arguments in lawsuit accusing Trump of rape
description: Lawyers for ex-President Donald Trump and writer E Jean Carroll make final statements in New York civil case.

title: US charges driver in fatal crash near Texas migrant shelter
description: Police chief in border town of Brownsville, Texas says officials have not ruled out whether the crash was intentional.

title: EU delegation cancels event in Israel over Ben-Gvir’s involvement
description: Delegation calls off Europe Day reception, saying it did not want to offer a platform to far-right Israeli minister.

title: Real Madrid vs Man City: Champions League semifinal preview
description: Bernabeu set to host mouth-watering semifinal first-leg clash between Real Madrid and Man City.

title: Popular Zimbabwean writer acquitted over anti-government protest
description: Tsitsi Dangarembga found guilty in 2022 of intent to incite public violence after organising anti-government protests.

title: Canadian fire crews battle blazes in western province of Alberta
description: Favourable weather could help efforts to contain more than 100 wildfires, Alberta officials say.

title: Opposition coalition in Republic of Congo holds first convention
description: Three parties in Congo-Brazzaville meet to lay out their objectives for the 2026 elections and challenge Nguesso's rule.

title: Danish oil tanker crew rescued after hijack off West Africa coast
description: The Liberian-flagged Monjasa Reformer was found off the coast of Sao Tome and Principe in the Gulf of Guinea.

title: A David vs Goliath battle unfolding in the dating app industry
description: Muzz, a relationship app for Muslims, has accused dating giant Match Group of trying to 'stifle' it.

title: Protesters arrested for violence at Turkish opposition rally
description: Ekrem Imamoglu of the main opposition party was speaking atop campaign bus when a large group began throwing rocks.

title: At SCO summit, India, Pakistan squabble over Kashmir, ‘terrorism’
description: Analysts say leaders from South Asian rival countries were 'more worried about internal politics than foreign policy'.

title: Four killed in Russian air attacks ahead of Victory Day: Ukraine
description: New wave of attacks launched ahead of Russian holiday commemorating Soviet victory over Nazi Germany.

title: More Iranian actresses summoned for not wearing hijab
description: This week alone, a sports federation chief resigns and several more actors face charges over mandatory hijab law.

title: How has the world reacted to Syria rejoining the Arab League?
description: There have been warm welcomes and scepticism, but most countries have opted for a muted response.

title: Timeline: Title 42 expulsions at the US-Mexico border
description: Biden administration is preparing for end of contentious US policy that let authorities turn away most asylum seekers.

title: Jordan behind attack that killed drug trafficker in Syria: SOHR
description: Two attacks reportedly targeted a drug factory and the home of drug dealer Marai al-Ramthan and his family.

title: Indian farmers break down barricades to join protesting wrestlers
description: Dozens of farmers join the athletes in calling for arrest of the sport's federation chief, accused of sexual harassment.

title: Uzbekistan’s leader calls for snap presidential election in July
description: New poll ordered a week after voters approve constitutional amendments allowing president to run for two more terms.

title: Malian political coalition opposes constitutional referendum
description: Political groups wants the cancellation of a referendum due to take place on June 18.

title: Five years after Trump’s exit, no return to the Iran nuclear deal
description: Trump’s slew of sanctions and a changing political climate have contributed to JCPOA remaining in limbo.

title: Fire at gold mine in Peru’s Arequipa kills at least 27 workers
description: Blaze sparked by short circuit engulfed one of the tunnels at remote La Esperanza 1 mine in southern Peru.

title: Photos: South Sudanese refugees return to their troubled home
description: More than 800,000 South Sudanese refugees lived in Sudan before fighting broke out there last month.

title: Two Congo virus-related deaths cause alarm in Pakistan
description: A total of 16 cases found in Balochistan province since the beginning of the year, of which 11 were detected this month.

title: Republicans are pushing American democracy to its breaking point
description: They are working within the boundaries of the democratic system in order to tear it down.

title: Iran executes two ‘Quran burners’ for blasphemy
description: The men were said to have insulted Islam and its prophets and run organised efforts to promote atheism.

title: Photos: Hundreds evacuated from Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant area
description: Nearly 1,700 people evacuated from two unspecified cities in the region as Russia steps up attacks against Ukraine.

title: ‘Brutal interference’: China tabloid rounds on S Korea criticism
description: Global Times lashes out at Seoul after its embassy complained about the tabloid's coverage of president's US visit.

title: Chile’s conservatives win most seats on constitution rewrite body
description: After a failed progressive majority rewrite, a collection of right-wing parties will now draft a new constitution.

title: Prado Salmon: Bolivian general who captured Che Guevara dies
description: Prado Salmon led a military operation backed by the US that captured the Argentinian communist revolutionary.

title: Sudan fighting in its 24th day: A list of key events
description: Ceasefire talks are taking place in Saudi Arabia while fighting continues in Khartoum.

title: Pakistan, Afghanistan agree to boost trade, lower border tensions
description: The two neighbours 'reaffirm their desire to pursue continuous and practical engagement' in bilateral talks.

title: The Palestinians and Israelis embracing peace
description: Some 15,000 Palestinians and Israelis came together to 'try to break the chain of revenge and hatred'.

title: At least 22 dead as tourist boat capsizes in India’s Kerala state
description: The incident happened in Tanur, a coastal town in Kerala's Malappuram district, and rescue operations are ongoing.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 439
description: As the war enters its 439th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Trump declines to testify in New York rape, defamation trial
description: Writer E Jean Carroll has accused former US president of assaulting her at a Manhattan department store in 1996.

title: Australian govt pledges $10bn to ease cost of living pressures
description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers insists measures will not add to country's already high inflation.

title: Biden aide discusses Yemen peace with Saudi Arabia’s MBS
description: National security adviser Jake Sullivan is in Riyadh discussing 'significant progress' in efforts to achieve Yemen peace

title: Russia launches air attacks on Ukraine ahead of key holiday
description: Concerns growing about the safety of the Zaporizhizhia nuclear power plant as civilians ordered to evacuate.

title: Thailand’s cannabis sellers say US growers are eating their lunch
description: Local cannabis growers say their business is being undercut by cheaper illegal imports from overseas.

title: At least 7 killed after car runs into crowd in Texas border town
description: The SUV ploughed into a group of people waiting for a bus near a shelter for refugees and migrants in the US.
